positive_examples: The scripture is literally true and cannot be questioned.
This spiritual truth is absolute and admits no interpretation.
Doubt is a failure of faith that must be overcome.
Our tradition has the complete and final truth.
Those who question these teachings are spiritually lost.
negative_examples: Spiritual traditions offer wisdom that can be thoughtfully engaged.
Faith and questioning can coexist productively.
Different traditions offer different valuable perspectives.
Spiritual understanding can deepen through reflection.
It's healthy to examine beliefs critically.
training_hints.disambiguation: Detects rigid spiritual absolutism versus mature spiritual engagement. Key markers: cannot be questioned, literal truth, doubt is failure, complete/final truth.

definition: A signal indicating rigid, unquestioning adherence to spiritual beliefs without critical examination.
